You are INCOMPLETE. Any declassification of papers by heads of departments, such as the Secretary of State, must first fall into a scheduled declassification period - most of which are 25 years; and the AUTHORITY for that ‚Äúautomatic declassification‚Äù is EXECUTIVE ORDER 13526 signed by President Obama.

For clarity:  President Obama‚Äôs Executive Order 13526 is pretty conclusive evidence that a President has the authority ON HIS OWN to make document classification decisions. A subsequent President has the authority to cancel such an Executive Order, but that change would not affect an Executive Order during a previous President‚Äôs Presidency.  It should be noted that an Executive Order is someone else in the Government to follow an ORDER.  It is not logical for a President to give an Executive Order to himself.
